courses.name: Writing in the Humanities & Social Sciences

college_profile.organization_type: Public research university; flagship; Hispanic-Serving Institution
college_profile.campus_setting: Urban main campus in Albuquerque (Central Ave NE)
college_profile.average_annual_cost: $11,000 average net price for in-state undergraduates (recent Scorecard)
college_profile.median_earnings: $41,000 median earnings 10 years after entry (College Scorecard)

financial_aid_and_debt.share_receiving_grant_aid: Most first-time students receive grants; around 40-45% receive Pell Grants
financial_aid_and_debt.pell_grant_rate: ~44% of full-time beginning students receive Pell Grants
financial_aid_and_debt.median_federal_loan_debt: $12,000 median federal loan debt; about $200/month standard plan
financial_aid_and_debt.federal_loan_participation: Roughly 45% of students borrow federal loans

college_profile.typical_earning_for_college_details_page: Graduates earn about $41K at the median ten years after enrolling (College Scorecard).
college_profile.campus_diversity: HSI with majority Hispanic/Latine alongside White, Native American, and international students; strong multicultural campus life.
college_profile.test_score: Selective admissions; test-optional pathways available (ACT/SAT considered if submitted).
college_profile.food: Room and board allowances (~$11.5K) cover housing and dining; commuter budgets allocate lower food costs.
college_profile.miscellaneous_expenses: $4,500 personal/other allowance used in cost of attendance.
college_profile.crime_rate: Urban campus with robust UNM PD presence; Clery reports typical large-campus incident rates.
college_profile.faculty_with_phd: Most full-time faculty hold terminal degrees; strong research-active professoriate.
college_profile.rank: ABET-accredited CS with strong research in AI, security, and networking.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Rigorous algorithms, systems, and software sequence with senior design and research options.
college_profile.facilities: High-performance computing labs, cybersecurity labs, maker/AI spaces, and collaborative classrooms.
college_profile.student_life: ACM/IEEE-CS chapters, hackathons, cyber competitions, and internships with regional labs and industry.

college_profile.typical_earning_for_college_details_page: Graduates earn about $41K at the median ten years after enrolling (College Scorecard).
college_profile.campus_diversity: HSI with majority Hispanic/Latine alongside White, Native American, and international students; strong multicultural campus life.
college_profile.test_score: Selective admissions; test-optional pathways available (ACT/SAT considered if submitted).

college_profile.rank: ABET-accredited ME program linked to energy, aerospace, and manufacturing research.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Strong fundamentals in thermo-fluids, design, controls, and senior capstone with industry sponsors.
college_profile.facilities: Wind tunnels, materials labs, advanced manufacturing, and HVAC/energy systems labs.
college_profile.student_life: ASME, Baja/Solar car teams, and undergraduate research with faculty labs.

college_profile.rank: CAEP-aligned teacher-prep program serving diverse NM classrooms.
college_profile.academic_excellence: Balanced methods, bilingual/ESL focus, and extensive fieldwork culminating in student teaching.
college_profile.facilities: Education tech labs, curriculum libraries, and partner school sites for practicum.
college_profile.student_life: Education clubs, tutoring initiatives, and community literacy outreach.
